instance.context:
Why he chose to throw his weight
behind a man who stood such a slender chance remains unclear .

He had withdrawn
behind his shield of mysterious self-possession .

He turned as he heard the door swish shut
behind her .

The sun was already dipping
behind the evening clouds and the colours and fun had disappeared .

The land drops
behind him . "

These bare poles are all that remains of the jungle that the lake drowned as the waters rose
behind the dam .

They stowed Tal
behind their seats , with her bag and all the other stuff that had accumulated there .

He cantered
behind the tower .

Vitor climbed
behind the wheel .

With the fifth in my pocket , I went back outside , climbed
behind the wheel and rolled away from the kerb .

Hunt 's boots were in front of him and he could hear Byrne crawling
behind him .

Christina crawled
behind one of the gaudily painted island buses for most of the journey , waving at several giggling little girls , their pig-tailed hair bouncing on pristine white uniform blouses .

Cecil crept up
behind Sam and poked him with his over-sized weapon .

The demon danced back
behind Rose 's eyes .

Sullivan registered the figure and darted
behind the curtains .

I hobbled
behind .

Fiver and Pipkin , limping
behind the others , and conspicuously under-sized and tired , were being attacked by the crow .

The rambling voice got lost in a maze of tenses as Twoflower ran along the dead tunnels , with the dragon loping along easily
behind him .
Behind his horse a dog loped obediently .

But as she loped reluctantly
behind Spittals onto the raised podium , shielding her eyes from the scorching white of the television lights , aware of an expectant murmur from faces she could not see , her lips were set in a pout of discontent .

Oliver marched grimly along
behind her .
Behind the cadets marched three hundred uniformed women soldiers of the army .

behind him .

Two guards marched in front of him , and two guards marched
behind him .

Richie glanced over his shoulder at the young PC pacing
behind them .

She seemed , to Tammuz , quite agitated , pacing up and down
behind her desk , swishing around in a long , belted gown .

He paced around
behind his desk , running his hand through his hair , uncertain of exactly what he was going to do .

Two huge gaolers , with the bodies of apes and the faces of cruel mastiffs , padded silently
behind them .

We were walking up the road from the hotel when a young man padded up
behind us and greeted us in English .

behind a rock to change ; Joyce was already in her swimsuit , prancing on long legs , showing her teeth .

behind a line of rocks .

Had she scuttled
behind it ? she wondered , as she filled her brush with colour .

He scuttled
behind the nearest tank and watched Fakrid and Jinkwa 's predictable reaction to the latest development with amusement .

The black girl laughed and skipped away
behind the curtain which led to the interior of the City of Dreams .

people who had made him skulk
behind trees until they had passed .

Manville jabbed his knuckles in the man 's back as he stepped up
behind him .

He reached for her and she stepped nimbly
behind a chair .

He pushed his hands in his pockets and stepped a little
behind her as she strode .

To complete her feeling of helplessness , he gagged her with a wide strip of thick linen , and stepped
behind her out of sight .

Straggling
behind her was a small child , about four or five , O could n't see what sex the child was .

On the way the children straggled
behind them or dived down lanes where archways blocked out the steadily mounting sun .

behind her , tall , white-haired , elegant .

behind the constable to find out what was happening .

behind her .

behind a piper , Cameron and Menzies recognized some stalwarts from Foss on Tummel .

behind the horses , he spoke to them constantly , in a caressing tone .

behind .

behind Evelyn , who took the cloth and started to rub out the first word with painstaking precision .

behind him , jostled a tall dark figure , turned to deliver a few suitable curses , and beheld Death .

behind the church . "

behind him and then I stopped with my feet on the ground and felt for the gun .

behind a small truck in which an airman held up a board reading FOLLOW ME , until they got to a Heinkel 111 whose propellers were already spinning .

behind him , at the lifeless , cluttered room .

The young man glanced
behind himself dubiously , into the interior .

Madge glanced
behind Lily to see that the dressing room door was shut .

From his expression there was not much chance of speaking to him at all and she cast a wary look
behind her to the door .

A quick anxious look
behind her and she found what she was looking for .

Grace looked quickly
behind her , and saw the people on the rock .

Edna wont be letting viewers peep
behind HER lace curtains .

behind the sand embankment across Boulevard Ariss went on watching the Syrian tanks , ignoring the sound .

behind the cab with shotguns .

behind some rocks , the idea of appropriating one of the horses had n't occurred to her .

behind a buttress of the church of St Nicholas long after curfew , my lips blue , my teeth chattering with the cold .

behind him , the Tominah advanced to the edge of a rock overlooking the pool by about six feet , closed his eyes and opened his betel-nut-rouged mouth .

behind the person and raise their shoulders slightly .

behind the counter and read the letter and Albert and Carrie watched him .

behind her and , when she said the word , helped her to heave the load from the ground .

behind them .

behind him , the face with its knotted eyes lurching in his arms .

behind his ear and was captured .

Yes , thought Dyson , at that I can feel a pricking
behind the lids of my eyes !

behind the counter .

behind its quays and boats and sheds .

Then a distorted voice began speaking , his silhouette vaguely seen
behind the milky glass .

Then they were gone , and he craned back to see
behind him , to see if they were following .

behind every bush but despite the weariness that dulled their senses these half-seen forms of rock among the trees seemed now to imply a threatening human presence .

behind the dark wooded hills , the sky translucent delicate silk .

behind the bars of the grate .

behind the attacker 's kneecap with his foot .

behind bars like everyone else " .

behind the shop in the middle of town , fed it on sprouts and boiled potatoes and encouraged Nutty to turn it into a show-jumper .

behind her closed eyes .

behind the cottage , a craggy natural fortress where Iron Age remains of habitation can still be seen , to look back from two hundred feet up .

behind Haworth , and the winds blow all winter .

behind the waterfall .

behind the house .

behind her .

behind the first man who was hauling back his breath in short gasps .

behind the wall of the sedan chair and the bullets ricocheted off what could only be metal .

behind his wide red braces , ` but of course that would n't work . "

behind me now and get going again .

behind his back .

behind her , on silent feet , a dark man with hooded eyes stalked her .

behind a bush .

behind Evans .

behind them , Cranston leaned against it , gasping for clean air , his great body quivering like a beached whale 's .

behind us and the key turn in the lock .

behind the adage -- until now .

behind his back .

behind trees , and motionless .

behind the housing facades , green oases growing vegetables , fruit trees , herbs and flowers .

behind other trees and rhododendron bushes .

behind a curtain .

behind an eighteen-foot high wall .

behind them began walking towards her along the hedge .

behind the Wall 's north-western edge .

behind the wattle of leafless branches , and the air had a chilly edge .

behind the panel flashed on momentarily .

In England it lies concealed
behind Tescos and the shopping mall .

behind groves of sombre cypresses .

behind the mother to squirt milk into the bottle .

behind him .

There was a man seated
behind the desk reading a book .

behind the desk .

behind the pulpit at the organ .

behind her .

behind him and he dropped on to it , sitting forward , gripping the sideboard .

behind a big , glass case that had a capercailzie in it .

behind him as one of the players hurled the white down the table , scattering the colours .

behind her , and Ronni could feel his annoyance growing .

behind the medics .

behind her .

I trailed
behind him .

behind Melissa .

behind him , vaguely looking for a fresh drink and finding Ages instead , who had been more than vaguely looking for him .

He trailed along
behind her through the sand dunes , along the edge of the tidal salt marsh .

behind Ockleton , bemused as he always was by beeswaxed pews and glittering plate in what experience had taught him was an irreligious world .

behind him .

behind swollen grey clouds which threatened a rougher crossing back to the island than the trip earlier on .

behind the altar screen with a last puff of smoke and the chanting came to an end .

behind a withdrawn expression which gave absolutely nothing away .

behind Jimmy .

behind a stack of deckchairs and extinguished his cigarette .

Then he waved , and vanished
behind the black glass .

` You English , " she said , and vanished
behind the screen .
